abstract.text: Control an app’s access to protected system services and user data.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Before your app can access certain protected resources, like the Bluetooth interface, location information, or the user’s photos, the system asks the user for permission on behalf of your app. To signal that your app needs the access, you add a
. You set the value associated with the key to a string that explains why your app needs access. The system displays this string when prompting the user, as described in

abstract.text: Resources located in an app, framework, or plugin bundle.
A resource containing key-value pairs that identify and configure a bundle.
A Boolean value indicating whether the app uses encryption.
The export compliance code provided by App Store Connect for apps that require it.
A message that tells the user why the app is requesting access to the device’s NFC hardware.
A message that tells the user why the app needs to access files in other apps’ sandbox containers.
